00048 /*****************************************************************************\
00049  *
00050  *  File:  mbuf.c
00051  *
00052  *  Description:  Self-resizing buffer useful for reading in files
00053  *
00054  *  Creation Date :  October 1994
00055  *
00056  *  Authors:  John C. Gyllenhaal, Wen-mei Hwu
00057  *
00058  *  Revisions:
00059  *

00061 
00062 /* 10/29/02 REK Adding config.h */
00063 #include <config.h>
00064 #include <stdio.h>
00065 #include <stdlib.h>
00066 #include <string.h>
00067 #include <ctype.h>
00068 #include <library/i_error.h>
00069 
00070 #include "mbuf.h"
00071 
00072 
00073 L_Alloc_Pool *Mbuf_pool = NULL;
00074 
00075 Mbuf *
00076 create_Mbuf ()
00077 {
00078   Mbuf *mbuf;
00079 
00080   /* Get memory for mbuf, alloc pool on first use */
00081   if (Mbuf_pool == NULL)
00082     {
00083       Mbuf_pool = L_create_alloc_pool ("Mbuf", sizeof (Mbuf), 16);
00084     }
00085   mbuf = (Mbuf *) L_alloc (Mbuf_pool);
00086 
00087   /* Initialize fields */
00088   mbuf->buf = NULL;
00089 
00090   clear_Mbuf (mbuf);
00091 
00092   /* Return mbuf ready to go */
00093   return (mbuf);
00094 }
00095 
00096 void
00097 free_Mbuf (Mbuf * mbuf)
00098 {
00099   /* Free buffer, then mbuf */
00100   free (mbuf->buf);
00101   L_free (Mbuf_pool, mbuf);
00102 }
00103 
00104 
00105 void
00106 clear_Mbuf (Mbuf * mbuf)
00107 {
00108   /* If never initialized before, malloc initial buffer */
00109   if (mbuf->buf == NULL)
00110     {
00111       mbuf->max_len = 2;
00112       if ((mbuf->buf = (char *) malloc (mbuf->max_len)) == NULL)
00113         I_punt ("Out of memory in clear_Mbuf");
00114     }
00115 
00116   /* Clear out buffer */
00117   mbuf->cur_len = 0;
00118   mbuf->buf[0] = 0;
00119 }
00120 
00121 void
00122 addc_to_Mbuf (Mbuf * mbuf, char ch)
00123 {
00124   char *old_buf;
00125 
00126   /* If at end of current buffer, malloc new one and copy over
00127    * contents.
00128    */
00129   if ((mbuf->cur_len + 1) >= mbuf->max_len)
00130     {
00131       old_buf = mbuf->buf;
00132 
00133       /* Double size of buffer */
00134       mbuf->max_len = mbuf->max_len * 2;
00135 
00136       /* Malloc new buffer */
00137       if ((mbuf->buf = (char *) malloc (mbuf->max_len)) == NULL)
00138         I_punt ("Out of memory in addc_to_Mbuf");
00139 
00140       /* Copy over old buffer */
00141       strcpy (mbuf->buf, old_buf);
00142 
00143       /* Free old buffer */
00144       free (old_buf);
00145     }
00146 
00147   /* Add character to buf (and terminate) */
00148   mbuf->buf[mbuf->cur_len] = ch;
00149   mbuf->buf[mbuf->cur_len + 1] = 0;
00150   mbuf->cur_len++;
00151 }
00152 
00153 void
00154 adds_to_Mbuf (Mbuf * mbuf, char *str)
00155 {
00156   char *ptr;
00157 
00158   for (ptr = str; *ptr != 0; ptr++)
00159     addc_to_Mbuf (mbuf, *ptr);
00160 }
00161 
00162 /* Pads buffer until length specified.  Does nothing if aleady longer 
00163  * than desired length
00164  */
00165 void
00166 pad_Mbuf_to_len (Mbuf * mbuf, int desired_len, char pad_ch)
00167 {
00168   while (desired_len > mbuf->cur_len)
00169     addc_to_Mbuf (mbuf, pad_ch);
00170 }
00171 
00172 /* Strips trailing whitespace from mbuf */
00173 void
00174 strip_Mbuf (Mbuf * mbuf)
00175 {
00176   int i;
00177 
00178   /* Find last non-whitespace */
00179   for (i = mbuf->cur_len - 1; i >= 0; i--)
00180     {
00181       if (!isspace (mbuf->buf[i]))
00182         break;
00183     }
00184 
00185   /* Adjust length and terminator */
00186   mbuf->cur_len = i + 1;
00187   mbuf->buf[i + 1] = 0;
00188 }
00189 
00190 /* return's a pointer to the actual mbuf (must not write to or free) */
00191 char *
00192 get_Mbuf_buf (Mbuf * mbuf)
00193 {
00194   return (mbuf->buf);
00195 }
00196 
00197 /* Copy mbuf's contents, may have NULLs in string so use len info */
00198 char *
00199 copy_Mbuf_buf (Mbuf * mbuf)
00200 {
00201   char *buf, *src_buf;
00202   int i, len;
00203 
00204   len = mbuf->cur_len;
00205 
00206   if ((buf = (char *) malloc (len + 1)) == NULL)
00207     I_punt ("copy_Mbuf_buf: Out of memory");
00208 
00209   src_buf = mbuf->buf;
00210   for (i = 0; i < len; i++)
00211     buf[i] = src_buf[i];
00212 
00213   /* Terminate string */
00214   buf[len] = 0;
00215 
00216   return (buf);
00217 }
00218 
00219 
00220 /* Returns length of mbuf */
00221 int
00222 len_of_Mbuf (Mbuf * mbuf)
00223 {
00224   return (mbuf->cur_len);
00225 }
00226 
00227 /* Returns 1 if string matches mbuf, 0 otherwise */
00228 int
00229 match_Mbuf (Mbuf * mbuf, char *string)
00230 {
00231   if (strcmp (mbuf->buf, string) == 0)
00232     return (1);
00233   else
00234     return (0);
00235 }
